performer: suno pi toki pona (kala pona Tonyu, jan Kepe)
title: Opening | open
description: Welcome to Toki Pona Day!

title: writing contest celebration! | utala musi pi pali lipu
description: Let’s celebrate the amazing work of everyone who submitted to the writing contest. Tune in to hear people reading excerpts of their work on air, some elementary Toki Pona literature analysis, and the contest results!

title: farm whisperers | nasa waso
description: toki pona adaptation of an episode from Escape This Podcast

title: The Basics of luka pona | sona open pi luka pona
description: LPSL (luka pona sign language) is the most popular sign language in the toki pona community. Curious about luka pona but don’t know where to start? This thirty-minute tutorial will show you the basics!

title: toki pona music by jan Kepi | kalama musi pi toki pona tan jan Kepi
description: showing off a remastered version of the two songs i presented last sptp. might talk for a bit after about the music stuff, if i’m available

title: Let's Move with Laban Movement Analysis! | o tawa kepeken nasin Lapan!
description: Practice your Toki Pona listening skills, learn about Laban Movement Analysis, and move around in a bunch of fun ways! This will be a toki pona taso lesson on a few basic ideas from Laban Movement Analysis, a system for describing human movement used in dance, theatre, voice acting, and more—and a chance to move around and be a little silly during the livestream.

title: creativity!! | musi a
description: music from my tp selection (maybe a new song if its finished - dont count on it) plus improvising for the audience. will be with my live guitar setup where i sing, play guitar, and play cajon and cabasa with foot drums

title: music by jan Kepe | kalama musi pi jan Kepe
description: some songs from my newest album!

title: kalama sin | kalama sin
description: You can listen to the podcast ‘kalama sin’ on many platforms. It’s a small community project done exclusively in toki pona. On suno pi toki pona, tune in to a live edition with jan Deni, jan Luke, jan Tepo, and maybe others!

title: creativity!! (again) | musi a (tu)
description: music from my tp selection (maybe a new song if its finished - dont count on it) plus improvising for the audience. will be with my live guitar setup where i sing, play guitar, and play cajon and cabasa with foot drums (all this but over again. will figure out what songs to play the night before.)

title: jan goose plays/goose's gartic phone | jan kuse musi
description: mostly a placeholder for now but i plan on playing shelter 2 or hosting a game of gartic phone

title: QnA by Sonja! | pana pi wile sona tan jan Sonja
description: Sonja Lang, the creator of toki pona, will be answering some of your questions in this segment!

description: tiling solo game

description: Singing toki pona songs of mine—and while I likely can’t do some of the covers on it, celebrating the release of toki Gaming!

description: showing off a remastered version of the two songs i presented last sptp. might talk for a bit after about the music stuff, if i’m available

title: Mappo | o musi Mapo!
description: Social deduction game, played in toki pona. Figure out who the werewolves are, and exile them before they kill you!

title: Surveying words | wile sona nimi
description: Opening the annual word survey. Talking about past word surveys

title: How to Use Jargons in Toki Pona? nasin Lapan and more | toki pi nasin ante lon toki pona? nasin Lapan en sin
description: Scientific, political, and similar sets of terminology are know to be a weak spot for Toki Pona, but is there a way to effectively use (at leas some) jargons in Toki Pona while still staying true to the language? In this conversational discussion, I’ll share some of the principles I used to translate the terminology of Laban Movement Analysis into Toki Pona, how these might apply more broadly, and the possible benefits of using Toki Pona in these situations. This will also serve as an English-language Q&A for those coming from o tawa kepeken nasin Lapan!

title: The Basics of luka pona | sona open pi luka pona
description: LPSL (luka pona sign language) is the most popular sign language in the toki pona community. Curious about luka pona but don’t know where to start? This thirty-minute tutorial will show you the basics!

title: Salvage the Spinach Bed: No-weeding garden technique! | nasin pali: o kipisi e kasi, o kama e kili!
description: Maybe you’ve heard of no-dig gardening… now, try no weeding! This video will show you how to salvage a runaway vege garden with some shears and sheer willpower, all in Toki Pona.

title: Everything is Numbers (toki pona) | ale li nanpa (toki pona)
description: You’ve heard before that everything could be numbers. Why is this? I’ll tell you!

title: Everything is Numbers (English) | ale li nanpa (toki Inli)
description: You’ve heard before that everything could be numbers. Why is this? I’ll tell you! (Translation of previous scheduled segment- but not translated like you think!)

description: once, kulupu pi toki musi was a flourishing youtube channel, but one day it disappeared into oblivion… now, it has returned! what’s up?

title: music by jan Usawi | kalama musi pi jan Usawi
description: Singing toki pona songs of mine—and while I likely can’t do some of the covers on it, celebrating the release of toki Gaming!
